runs.comm: good ball, as ever, right on the money and swinging into the right hander who plays it back to the bowler. Gough throws his head back in disgust, for no apparent reason other than he didn't get a wicket first ball
great line outside off stump, defended off the back foot into the covers

ooh dropped by Trescothick at first slip as the right hander comes forward, edges him to Trescothick's left and Chris Read's right...Trescothick goes for it, but misses. That was Read's catch and he didn't consider going for it, down to the third man boundary. Gough is livid, and rightly so
touch too short and well timed through the covers for three
pushed to short mid-off without any timing
a little too full here from Gough who is whipped to deep square leg for a couple more
well wide of the off stump and immediately induces a swing-and-a-miss from the batsman
a good length again, too wide though and he's driven straight to mid-off
good bounce from a good length - that's his height coming into play there - and he gallops down the pitch to field, giving the batsman a stare
full once more, driven to mid-off
just a bit too straight and short allowing the batsman to turn him away for a single
excellent ball outside the off stump, short, and cramping the right hander for room
ooh a swing-and-a-miss from the batsman to one which swings away from the right hander
fantastic ball, the perfect length cutting back into the batsman who flashes at thin air again
a little too straight this time and he is whipped off his legs to wide long-on
flicked off his pads in the air and past the diving midwicket - really ought to have stopped that - and they pick up three
excellent line and length forcing a defensive shot, played down by his toes
swinging in to the right hander who spoons this over cover. Kevin Pietersen sprints back to the boundary, keeping his eye on the ball which falls tantalisingly short of both him and the boundary
oooh, well bowled on off stump, Malik inside-edges this just past his stumps
very fine length again from Broad, and this one cuts back markedly to the right hander who can only defend it off the back foot. Good bounce
slightly too short - and too wide, really - allowing Malik to flail his hands at it and smote it over cover
GODDIM! Well bowled young Broad! Cuts back into Malik, Broad races down the pitch to appeal and the umpire raises his finger. And that's his first wicket for England
and another! Short, the bouncer and Khan attempts to pull it but can only glove it to Chris Read behind the stumps who dives to his left and takes a great catch. He's on a hat-trick!
and he's smacked this miles into the air, where's this one gone?! Mid on (and off) both sprint back but it's safe, and they save four. What an over!
drifts this down the leg side and he whips him through midwicket
hello! Hafeez sweeps him over Broad at leg slip, great shot
chipped to the leg side
what a shot, Afridi slaps Mahmood over his head - absolutely no timing at all there, but such is his power that it fairly zooted for four
and the bouncer but it's wide, and Afridi flashes and misses. And it's called a wide, too
ooh what a shot, there's Afridi's power. Slightly too short and he pulls it with immense power
and he goes outside the leg stump, hitting this inside out over extra cover this time! Classic Afridi
oh dear, Mahmood's rather lost his composure here as he sends down another wide
very well bowled! On off stump and it flies past Afridi's bat who tries to hit this into Wales and misses
fine shot, driven straight down the ground. Very well timed indeed
a little too straight from Broad this time, allowing the batsman to turn him around the corner
Broad goes wide of the crease and sends down a very fine yorker - clever bowling
down on one knee and Afridi spoons this, without middling it, over cow corner for four
yikes! He's got hold of this one! Afridi swings this miles into the stand for six - in fact, out of the ground and clattering into the buildings on the street
wide of the crease and full, Afridi takes a step outside his leg stump and scythes it, flat, over point...very nearly for six
good start from Dalrymple, on off stump and forcing the defensive. No run there
well bowled - the arm ball - and Hafeez misses out here, swings and misses
too short and pumped down to long on for a single

and immediately Afridi swings this into Wales...oh no, hang on, it's up in the air, Yardy jogs back, and back further, and dives backwards to take the catch in front of his face, lying on his back! What a catch!
far too wide, and called as such
full and outside off stump, neatly and calmly timed to long off
outside the off stump and Yousuf attempts a reverse sweep but misses
outside the off stump and edged past where second slip might have been, down to Yardy at third man who fields and flings it back to Read...and hits the stumps, too.
good length but wide enough to allow the batsman to angle it down to third man
short - certainly too short to be driving, and the batsman can only push it into the covers
wide of the crease, wide of the stumps too and driven over the infield out to Yardy who runs round from third man
short-arm pull outside off through midwicket for four. Just a touch too short from Broad
defended off the back foot
very nicely flighted by Dalrymple, enticing the drive and Yousuf edges this down to third man for four
wide down the leg side
full outside the off stump, pushed to cover
ooh well bowled again, passing the outside edge
pushed back to the bowler
short but again Yousuf can't time this as it bobbles into the covers
sliced past point down to third man
lands this on leg stump, good start
much quicker (66mph) but down the leg side and turned around the corner
right in the slot for Yousuf who pings it back over Yardy's head for a massive six
fuller but too straight and is turned down to fine leg
pumped over the top to long-on
very nicely bowled, the yorker, forcing the defensive
and he starts nicely with a ball outside off stump which Yousuf defends to point
driven straight to cover
slower ball which Yousuf reads, watches it carefully and pushes it into the covers
the bouncer, quick and straight and Yousuf top-edges it over the wicketkeeper, Read, for four. Very lucky - well bowled
slower ball spooned round to Broad at fine leg who fields it neatly
slower ball pushed back to Mahmood who threatens to throw down the stumps, and the crowd roar their approval at the mock-aggression on show.
tries to sweep and misses - beaten by pace
much too straight but the batsman misses out, it bobbles off his pad and they scamper through for a single
swept to Darren Gough at short fine-leg
good catch! Outside leg stump, Yousuf swings it to Ian Bell's right at long-on who sprints round and takes it inches inside the boundary rope at knee height
a full bunger hit back to Yardy who can't get down in time and they pick up a single
defended by Inzamam on the front foot
good length outside the off stump and crisply struck to point. No run there.
very well bowled, the slower ball which deceives the batsman who can't get it away
a touch fuller and he smashes this with great power but Dalrymple makes a fine stop at cover

a touch straighter, the batsman attempts to flick this on the leg side but the ball bobbles off his pad into the off side. Mahmood sprints athletically down the pitch, Hafeez goes for a run and is very nearly run out by Mahmood's throw...but it's wide of the stumps
wide of the off stump, and called as such
full, wide, neatly timed to Pietersen at deep point but with no great power
straight and full, driven to mid-on
oh what a shot, quite remarkably played by Hafeez who reverse sweeps it with immense power all along the ground past point
pushes this to long-on for a single, clever cricket
Inzy skips down the pitch but misses this and it hits his pad
check-driven to long-off without great power
well flighted by Yardy and Hafeez is beaten, mistiming it
wide down the leg side
and he tucks Inzamam up for room here

slower ball slapped over midwicket, Trescothick pulls off a great diving stop and sends in a good throw to Dalrymple, waiting at the non-striker's end who throws down the stumps and Inzy is just home. Just!
defended on the front foot, very well bowled
pushed to cover who sends in a throw at the wrong end
slower ball, Hafeez tries to pull it but inside-edges it into his pad and it barely misses his leg stump. Very, very close indeed
shot! Full toss from Collingwood, and a slow one at that, and Hafeez flicks it down to the vacant fine leg for four. Neat stroke
Inzamam simply swings through the line, timing it perfectly and smashing it commandingly over long-on. Fabulous shot!
good reply, swinging into Inzamam who clips it to point. No run on offer there
well bowled in the corridor of uncertainty, Inzamam flicks and misses
too quick for Inzamam who is beaten by pace and hit on the pad. They run a quick single though
super inswinging yorker there from Gough - very nearly breaks through Hafeez's defences but he jams his bat down. That's the Gough of old...

inswinging yorker once more, but it's wide and chipped to Collingwood at backward point, who mis-fields it and the ball bobbles up. He collects, takes aim and throws down the stumps to leave Hafeez short by several feet. Brilliant fielding
short, and very slow, allowing Inzamam to tickle it fine for a single
very fluently driven past the diving midwicket, but Dalrymple fields it coming round from long-off
Inzamam misses out here, completely misreading the slower ball
flicked wristily from outside the off stump to fine leg, beautifully played
slower ball which Razzaq reads and clobbers it, opening the face, over cover. Super shot
short, slow, and cracked over midwicket for four! Dreadful bowling
attempted yorker but it's timed on the full by Inzamam to the leg side
pushed off the back foot but straight to extra cover
outside off, Razzaq swings and misses - and it's called a wide! That's a bit tough on Gough who shakes his head and wears the most wry of smiles
whacked to Stuart Broad at mid-off
times this over the infield, over cover, and the scores are level
smashes this high in the air, long-on sprints back to the boundary and dives...but can't hold on and, as if to rub further salt into his wounds, it goes for four to end the match
